name: Puno Cathedral
description: Built in 1757, this baroque-mestizo cathedral is an architectural symbol of the city.

name: Carlos Dreyer Museum
description: Museum showcasing a collection of pre-Inca, Inca, and colonial artifacts, including ceramics and gold and silver objects.

name: Casa del Corregidor
description: A 17th-century colonial house hosting a caf√© and a local crafts store.

name: Plaza Vea Puno
description: Supermarket offering a wide variety of local and imported products.

name: Mojsa Restaurant
description: A renowned restaurant serving contemporary Peruvian cuisine with views of the Main Square.

name: Hotel Libertador Lake Titicaca
description: Luxury hotel located on a private island with panoramic views of Lake Titicaca.

name: Central Market of Puno
address: Jr. Lampa with Jr. Tacna, Puno, Peru
description: Traditional market where fresh produce and local handicrafts can be found.

name: Inka's Expression
description: Handicraft shop offering a variety of Andean textile products and souvenirs.
